com.defano.jmonet.tools.selection

Interface Selection

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableSelection, TransformableCanvasSelection, TransformableImageSelection, TransformableSelection
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectionTool, AbstractTransformTool, LassoTool, PerspectiveTool, ProjectionTool, RotateTool, RubberSheetTool, ScaleTool, SelectionTool, SlantTool

    public interface Selection
    Represents an image selection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PaintCanvas getCanvas()
      Gets the canvas on which the selection is being made.
      default Shape getIdentitySelectionOutline()
      Gets the current selection outline's shape, located at (0, 0).
      BufferedImage getSelectedImage()
      Gets the image represented by the selection, or null, if no selection exists.
      Point getSelectionLocation()
      Determines the location (top-left coordinate) of the selection outline (getSelectionOutline() on the canvas, relative to the top-left coordinate of the canvas.
      Shape getSelectionOutline()
      Gets the current selection outline's shape and location, i.e., the path on the canvas where "marching ants" will be drawn.
      boolean hasSelection()
      Determines if the user has an active selection.
      default BufferedImage maskSelection(BufferedImage image)
      Creates a new image in which every pixel not within the selected shape (i.e., bounded by marching ants) has been changed to fully transparent.
      void redrawSelection()
      Clears the scratch buffer then draws the selected image and selection outline ("marching ants") onto it.

    • Method Detail

      • getCanvas

        PaintCanvas getCanvas()
        Gets the canvas on which the selection is being made.
        Returns:
        The active canvas.

      • getSelectionLocation

        Point getSelectionLocation()
        Determines the location (top-left coordinate) of the selection outline (getSelectionOutline() on the canvas, relative to the top-left coordinate of the canvas.
        Returns:
        Get the top-left coordinate of the selection boundary

      • getSelectionOutline

        Shape getSelectionOutline()
        Gets the current selection outline's shape and location, i.e., the path on the canvas where "marching ants" will be drawn. Note that the location of the shape's bounds is translated to the selection's location on the canvas. Use getIdentitySelectionOutline() for a selection outline located at (0, 0) and suitable for testing whether a pixel in the selected image is within the selection shape's mask.
        Returns:
        The selection outline's shape and location on the canvas

      • getIdentitySelectionOutline

        default Shape getIdentitySelectionOutline()
        Gets the current selection outline's shape, located at (0, 0). This method returns a shape useful for testing whether a pixel in the selected image's raster (see getSelectedImage()) is contained within the selection.
        Returns:
        The selection outline's shape

      • hasSelection

        boolean hasSelection()
        Determines if the user has an active selection. A selection exists only after the user has completed defining a closed, selection outline.
        Returns:
        True is a selection exists, false otherwise.

      • getSelectedImage

        BufferedImage getSelectedImage()
        Gets the image represented by the selection, or null, if no selection exists.

        Note that a user can select a non-rectangular selection, but the selected image returned by this method will always be a rectangle whose bounds are the smallest rectangle that can fit in the selected shape (i.e., getSelectionOutline()).

        Any pixels outside the user's selection shape will be fully transparent pixels in the returned image.

        Returns:
        The selected image

      • redrawSelection

        void redrawSelection()
        Clears the scratch buffer then draws the selected image and selection outline ("marching ants") onto it.

      • maskSelection

        default BufferedImage maskSelection(BufferedImage image)
        Creates a new image in which every pixel not within the selected shape (i.e., bounded by marching ants) has been changed to fully transparent.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to mask
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage in which every pixel not within the selection has been made transparent
